title: Undergraduate Student Profiles | Department of Mechanical and Industrial Engineering | University of Illinois at Chicago
text: Industrial Engineering, BS ’21 | Chicago Heights, IL
Name one thing you think UIC does better than anywhere else: UIC brings people of different backgrounds together.
Most challenging engineering project/assignment you’ve conquered so far: Setting up Arduino hardware/code to calculate the velocities of toy cars going down a ramp at a given height.
Student/campus organizations you’ve joined: UIC Radio, Latin American Recruitment and Educational Services (LARES) Leaders, Society of Hispanic Professional Engineers
Place you’re most likely to be found on campus, and why: SEL (Science and Engineering Labs) or Student Center East, simply because there are many different areas to study and do homework.
Favorite place in Chicago: La Michoacana Premium ice cream shop in Pilsen.
Industrial Engineering, BS ’20 | Elgin, IL

Favorite thing about the department you’re majoring in: I really love all the professors in the MIE department. They all seem to take interest in their students and make sure they learn the material instead of memorizing it.

Student organizations you’ve joined: Asian American Students in Alliance (public relations officer), EVO Dance Troupe (co-coordinator), American Institute of Astronautics and Aeronautics (Design, Build, Fly design team captain), Society of Asian Scientists and Engineers, Women in Science and Engineering, Society of Women Engineers, Alpha Phi Omega

Engineering-industry person you admire most and why: Lillian Gilbreth, because she was the first woman to get a PhD in industrial engineering and the first woman elected to the National Academy of Engineering.

Place you’re most likely to be found on campus, and why: The Asian American Resource and Cultural Center because it’s a home away from home, and it’s nice to connect with people who share a similar background as me.
Mechanical Engineering, BS ’20 | Wheaton, IL

Why did you choose UIC College of Engineering? I was a mechanic throughout most of my teenage years and developed a love for all things mechanical. I have always had a desire to create, innovate, and lead. The UIC College of Engineering has offered me those opportunities and helped me to distinguish myself as a student and a leader.

Engineering project/assignment you did that you’re most proud of: My favorite project so far was my slingshot launcher that I developed alongside my team mates in ME 250 (Intro to Engineering Design and Graphics). We all got to explore the engineering workflow and develop every aspect of the design on our own, as if we were in the workforce. It was a challenging and humbling experience.
Student organizations you’ve joined: Competitive Gaming Club, the second largest club on campus with 700 members (president), Pi Tau Sigma, Tau Sigma
Internships you’ve held: Product validation engineer at Navistar.
Mechanical Engineering, BS ’20 | Mexico City
Engineering project/assignment you did that you’re most proud of: Project STELLA, our robot from Engineering Design Team that earned second place in a competition.
Student organizations you’ve joined: Service Leaders, Engineering Design Team, Society of Women Engineers, and American Society of Mechanical Engineers.
Favorite course: ME 205 (Intro to Thermodynamics)

How is the College of Engineering preparing you for the working world? With courses such as ME 347 (Intro to Computer-Aided Design) and Senior Design, we get true insight into the real world of engineering. Extracurricular activities are the cherry on top, where we can put our skills into practice and see them come to life.
Mechanical Engineering, BS ’20 | Skokie, IL
Favorite thing about the department you’re majoring in: The ME 250 (Intro to Engineering Design and Graphics) lab, with its access to 3D printing, project work space, a computer lab, and a wood shop.

What is the most valuable student organization you’ve joined, and why? Engineering World Health was my first real-world application at UIC where I felt like I was making a difference in the world. I met some of the nicest and most driven people in engineering.

Place you’re most likely to be found on campus, and why: SEL [Science and Engineering Laboratories building], because it’s my second engineering home. I work there as an undergraduate TA. Many of my classes are there, and it has comfy lounge areas and lab space to experiment.
What do you hope to be doing right after graduation? I hope either to get a master’s degree in energy engineering or begin working for an engineering company.
Mechanical Engineering, BS ’20 | Surabaya, Indonesia
Why did you choose UIC College of Engineering? The college is growing rapidly, and it offers great student activities.
Engineering project/assignment you did that you’re most proud of: Being a part of UIC’s Engineering Design Team (EDT) and winning second place.
Most challenging engineering project/assignment you’ve conquered so far: Finishing a prototype CAD model for my ME 250 (Intro to Engineering Design and Graphics) final project.
What is the most valuable student organization you’ve joined, and why? EDT because I am able to learn engineering skills and be a part of a team.
Place you’re most likely to be found on campus, and why: UIC’s bowling alley because it’s a cozy place to just sit around and do my assignments.
Mechanical Engineering, BS ’22 | Amman, Jordan
Why did you choose UIC College of Engineering? UIC is an affordable school. It has a great reputation and many opportunities. It’s also close to my home in Oak Lawn.
Favorite course: ME 250 (Intro to Engineering Design and Graphics)
Engineering-industry person you admire most and why: James Watt because he invented the steam engine, one of the greatest inventions to this day.
Place you’re most likely to be found on campus, and why: The library and Student Center East (SCE): the library to study, and SCE to hang out with friends.
Favorite place in Chicago: The Chicago Riverwalk.
Mechanical Engineering, BS ’20 | Singapore
Favorite course: ME 308 (Mechanical Vibrations)
Engineering project/assignment you did that you’re most proud of: I designed something for ME 347 (Intro to Computer-Aided Design) that has never before been introduced to market.
Student organizations you’ve joined: I’m the treasurer of UIC’s Society of Asian Scientists and Engineers and a member of UIC’s Society of Automotive Engineers.
What is the most valuable student organization you’ve joined, and why? Both are equally valuable as one gives me leadership experience and the other gives me technical experience.
Mechanical engineering, BS ’21 | Bridgeview, IL
Favorite course: I think my favorite course so far has been ME 210 Engineering Dynamics. What you use in the course is really relevant to engineering concepts that are used outside school.

Engineering project/assignment you did that you’re most proud of: Definitely Hyperloop. Our team has been collaborating with IIT to create a levitation pod and 30 meter test track. All this wouldn’t be possible without the help of the department and members within the organization.
Internships you’ve held: Northrop Grumman
Favorite book: Fahrenheit 451
Industrial Engineering, BS ’21 | Plymouth, MI

Name one thing you think UIC does better than anywhere else: Community. The people that I’ve met at UIC genuinely want to improve themselves and participate in engineering clubs and events. Having community support in your goals and actions helps make UIC feel like home.

Engineering project/assignment you did that you’re most proud of: I worked on a group project that minimized the wait time of a Starbucks drive-thru. It was a great opportunity to see the tangible results that industrial engineers can provide to any problem.

Student organizations you’ve joined: I am the treasurer for the Institute for Industrial and Systems Engineers (IISE), a member of the Society of Women Engineers (SWE), I play intermural volleyball, and I am in the gaming club.
Favorite musical artist: Dua Lipa
